sentences.en: He had decided to publish the manuscript no matter what.
sentences.cn: 他决定无论如何都要出版那部手稿。

sentences.en: He read through the manuscript and marked it up with his objections.
sentences.cn: 他把手稿通读了一遍,并在不同意的地方标了记号.

sentences.en: His poems are still in manuscript.
Many lines have been interpolated into the manuscript at a later date.
sentences.cn: 不少字句是后来添写进原手稿中去的.

sentences.en: None of Shakespeare's plays survives in its original manuscript form.
sentences.cn: 莎士比亚剧本的真迹已流失殆尽.

sentences.en: Seventeen publishers rejected the manuscript before Jenks saw its potential.
sentences.cn: 17家出版社回绝了这部手稿，直到詹克斯看到了它的潜在价值。

sentences.en: The adaptation of the play for radio manuscript was easy.
sentences.cn: 把剧本改编成广播稿很容易.

sentences.en: The manuscript had already been sent off to the printers.
sentences.cn: 原稿已经寄给印刷厂了。

sentences.en: The manuscript is just one of the treasures in their possession .
sentences.cn: 这部手稿只是他们的珍藏之一。

sentences.en: The manuscript will go to press early next month.
This is a manuscript bearing as a title Ruth.
sentences.cn: 这是一篇题为《鲁思》的手稿.

sentences.en: This is a valuable medieval manuscript.
sentences.cn: 这是一本有价值的中世纪手抄本.

sentences.en: This manuscript is so good that it deserves publication.
sentences.cn: 这份稿子太好了,值得刊载.

sentences.en: Unfortunately, parts of the original manuscript have been lost.
sentences.cn: 遗憾的是，部分原始手稿丢失了。

sentences.en: Who's pissing about with my manuscript? They're all out of order.
sentences.cn: 谁在乱动我的手稿? 全给弄得乱七八糟的.

trans.tran_en: a book or piece of writing before it is printed
